content.p: Solve the quadratic equation using factoring. Then solve either the cubic equation or the quartic equation using a more advanced factoring technique. Only report the answers that are real numbers.

item.p: The real solutions to the quadratic equation are x = {{root_1}},{{root_2}}. This is because {{quadratic_simple}} = {{quadratic}}.
{{cubic_phrase}} x = {{cubic_sol_1}}{{cubic_sol_2}}{{cubic_sol_3}}. This is because {{cubic_simple}} = {{cubic}}. You can see this if you factor by grouping.

For the quartic equation, {{fourth_phrase}}{{fourth_sol_1}}{{fourth_sol_2}}{{fourth_sol_3}}{{fourth_sol_4}}. This is because {{quartic_simple}} = {{quartic}}. You can see this if you notice that the quartic is quadratic in form.
